title.narrative: Remote Support Emergency WASH Officer Sanitation UNHCR Brazil

description.narrative: Brazil has the highest number of Venezuelans recognized refugees in Latin America with over 46,000 with an additional 100,000 Venezuelan asylum seekers and over 120,000 PoC under temporary resident permit status. Although the border with Venezuela was closed in 2020 due to COVID, decreasing the arrivals to Brazil. The numbers have been steadily increasing since September with over 5,000 arrivals to Boa Vista in January 2021. The results of this continued influx caused a considerable strain on the services in the 13 abrigos provided by the government and humanitarian agencies. The COVID pandemic has added an additional challenge to an already difficult response with financial resources to the Venezuela situation decreasing as the situation enters the fourth year. The Emergency WASH Officer (Sanitation) will support the UNHCR WASH emergency response in Roraima, with a strong focus on delivery of sanitation infrastructure to persons of concern to UNHCR. This will primarily include addressing the acute issues with regards to the water and sanitation infrastructure and services in the abrigos as well as helping both UNHCR staff and staff of WASH agencies by building their capacities, assisting in sanitation program design, implementation and monitoring. There will be a strong emphasis on their working closely with the entire UNHCR WASH Unit to more fully integrate sanitation into their ongoing work and linking to the Protection Unit to build on their strong community engagement activities.
